intro: Asperula affinis, commonly known as the alpine azalea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and rhododendrons, and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage. The plant produces showy clusters of pink or white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and prefers cool, moist environments. Asperula affinis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to grow in shaded, rocky conditions.
